payload.name: reference-class-outside-view
payload.core: Predict by anchoring on base-rate distribution of similar past cases rather than inside-view analysis of unique details. Primary antidote to planning fallacy.
out: reference class definition with inclusion/exclusion criteria
base rate distribution (mean, median, spread, failure rate)
adjustment rationale with direction and magnitude
proc: define reference class: specific enough to be relevant, broad enough for adequate data (aim for 10+ cases)
gather base rate statistics from actual outcomes (not plans): mean, median, SD, failure rate
assess similarity: rate case as above/at/below average on key factors
adjust from base rate with explicit justification; cap at 25% unless strong evidence
document uncertainty range and conditions that would revise estimate
check: reference class defined before seeing data?
using actual outcomes, not planned outcomes?
total adjustment within 25% unless strongly justified?
uncertainty range provided, not just point estimate?

diff.vs_case_based: uses statistical distribution of many cases, not individual case details or solutions
diff.vs_bayesian: provides the prior (base rate) that Bayesian updating starts from; they are complementary
diff.vs_analogical: applies statistical regularities, not structural mappings; more robust to surface-deep similarity mismatch

fail.desc: Too broad obscures relevant variation; too narrow lacks data. Signals: class chosen to support desired conclusion, fewer than 10 cases, ignoring structural differences, using planned vs actual outcomes.

rel.name: case-based
rel.link: retrieves specific cases; reference-class uses aggregate statistics

rel.name: bayesian-probabilistic
rel.link: base rates serve as priors for Bayesian updating

rel.name: inductive
rel.link: generalization that produces the base rates used here

ex.scenario: estimating time to complete backend API rewrite
ex.approach: reference class: API rewrites at mid-size companies; base rate: median 9mo, mean 12mo, 30% exceed 18mo; similarity: slightly below average (scope/dependencies offset experience); adjustment: +15% to 14mo; compare: inside-view was 6mo, outside-view is 14mo
